name: Number of integers k that are neither squarefree nor prime powers (in A126706) and that do not exceed primorial A002110(n).
formula: a(n) = P(n) - (Sum_{k=2..floor(log_2(P(n)))} pi(floor(P(n)^(1/k)))) - Sum_{k=1..floor(sqrt(P(n)))} mu(k)*floor(P(n)/(k^2)), where P(n) = A002110(n).
example: Let s = A126706 and let P(n) = A002110(n).
a(0..2) = 0 since P(0..2) = {1, 2, 6}, and the smallest number in s is 12.
mathematica: Table[# - Sum[PrimePi@ Floor[#^(1/k)], {k, 2, Floor[Log2[#]]}] - Sum[MoebiusMu[k]*Floor[#/(k^2)], {k, Floor[Sqrt[#]]}] &[Product[Prime[i], {i, n}]], {n, 0, 12}]
program: from sympy import primorial, primepi, integer_nthroot, mobius
return int(-sum(primepi(integer_nthroot(m,k)[0]) for k in range(2,m.bit_length()))-sum(mobius(k)*(m//k**2) for k in range(2, isqrt(m)+1))) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 24 2025
(PARI) a(n) = my(q=vecprod(primes(n))); q - sum(k=2, logint(q, 2), primepi(sqrtnint(q, k))) - sum(k=1, sqrtint(q), q\k^2*moebius(k)); \\ _Jinyuan Wang_, Feb 25 2025
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 23 2025
ext: Offset changed to 0 by _Jinyuan Wang_, Jan 24 2025

name: a(n) = A013928(A002110(n)).
mathematica: Table[-1 + Sum[MoebiusMu[k]*Floor[#/(k^2)], {k, Floor[Sqrt[#]]}] &[Product[Prime[i], {i, n}]], {n, 0, 12}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 24 2025 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = my(t=vecprod(primes(n))-1); sum(i=1, sqrtint(t), t\i^2*moebius(i)); \\ _Jinyuan Wang_, Jan 24 2025
return sum(mobius(k)*(m//k**2) for k in range(1,isqrt(m)+1)) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Jan 25 2025
author: _Mats Granvik_, Mar 16 2009
ext: Extended and offset corrected by _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 13 2009

name: Number of powerful numbers k that are not powers of primes (i.e., k is in A286708) that do not exceed the primorial number A002110(n).
formula: a(n) <= A380403(n) since A286708 is a proper subset of A126706.
example: a(0..3) = 0 since the smallest number in s is 36.
a(4) = 7 since P(4) = 210 and numbers in s that are less than 210 include {36, 72, 100, 108, 144, 196, 200}, etc.
mathematica: Table[-1 + Sum[If[MoebiusMu[j] != 0, Floor[Sqrt[#/j^3]], 0], {j, #^(1/3)}] - Sum[PrimePi@ Floor[#^(1/k)], {k, 2, Floor[Log2[#]]}] &[Product[Prime[i], {i, n}]], {n, 0, 12} ]
program: from sympy import primorial, primepi, integer_nthroot, mobius
def squarefreepi(n): return int(sum(mobius(k)*(n//k**2) for k in range(1, isqrt(n)+1)))
c, l, j = int(squarefreepi(integer_nthroot(m, 3)[0])-sum(primepi(integer_nthroot(m,k)[0]) for k in range(2,m.bit_length()))-1), 0, isqrt(m)
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 24 2025

name: Number of k <= 10^n that are neither squarefree nor prime powers (i.e., k is in A126706).
formula: a(n) = 10^n - Sum_{k = 2..log_2(10^n)} pi(floor(10^(n/k))) - Sum_{k = 1..floor(sqrt(10^n))} mu(k)*floor(10^n/k^2), where pi = A000720 and mu = A008683.
example: a(1) = 0 since the smallest term in S is 12.
mathematica: Table[10^n - Sum[PrimePi@ Floor[10^(n/k)], {k, 2, Floor[Log2[10^n]]}] - Sum[MoebiusMu[k]*Floor[10^n/(k^2)], {k, Floor[Sqrt[10^n]]}], {n, 10}]
program: from sympy import primepi, integer_nthroot, mobius
return int(-sum(primepi(integer_nthroot(m,k)[0]) for k in range(2,m.bit_length()))-sum(mobius(k)*(m//k**2) for k in range(2, isqrt(m)+1))) # _Chai Wah Wu_, Feb 23 2025
author: _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 22 2025
